item.title: EBL, Mastercard collaborate to deliver faster, safer remittance to Bangladesh
item.description: Eastern Bank PLC (EBL) has entered into a strategic collaboration with Mastercard to leverage its Transaction Services platform, aiming to enhance and streamline cross-border remittance capabilities to Bangladesh. According to a press release, this association will enhance the speed, security, and

item.title: Late Rakib strike salvages draw for Bangladesh against 10-man Hong Kong
item.description: Bangladesh clawed back from a penalty setback to snatch a point late against a 10-man Hong Kong, thanks to a perfectly placed finish by Rakib Hossain, keeping their Asian Cup qualification hopes faintly alive. Bangladesh had lost the first leg 4-3 at the National Stadium in Paltan on Thursday, lea

item.title: Mine blast injures Bangladeshi, kills Myanmar national
item.description: A Bangladeshi man has been injured, while a Myanmar national has died in a landmine explosion along the zero line of the Alikadam border in Bandarban, according to the Border Guard Bangladesh (BGB). The explosion took place around 10am on Tuesday near the Poamuhuri border in Kurukpata Union of the

item.title: MPO teachers return to Shaheed Minar, threaten ‘Shahbagh blockade’
item.description: Private school and college teachers under the MPO scheme have returned to Central Shaheed Minar, after abandoning plans to march towards the Secretariat following police barricades at the High Court’s Mazar gate. By 8:15pm on Tuesday, the group was seen moving in organised ranks towards Shah

item.title: Burnt Mirpur plant ‘not linked to BGMEA’
item.description: The Bangladesh Garment Manufacturers and Exporters Association (BGMEA) has said the factory in Mirpur’s Rupnagar, where a deadly fire broke out, is not a member of the organisation. According to a statement from the trade body on Tuesday, the facility in Shiallbari is a washing plant, not a

item.title: Tarique Rahman expresses shock over Mirpur fire; calls for transparent probe
item.description: BNP Acting Chairman Tarique Rahman on Tuesday expressed deep shock and sorrow over the devastating fire at a garment factory and a chemical warehouse in the Shialbari area of Mirpur, urging a transparent investigation to ensure those responsible are brought to justice. In a post on his verified Fa

item.title: IMF forecasts modest economic recovery for Bangladesh
item.description: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has projected that Bangladesh’s economy will experience a modest recovery in the current fiscal year 2025-26 (FY26). The multilateral lender forecasted that Bangladesh’s gross domestic product (GDP) growth could reach 4.9 percent in FY26, according

item.title: Security heightened ahead of RUCSU polls
item.description: The authorities concerned have taken strict security measures ahead of Rajshahi University Central Students’ Union (RUCSU), Senate student representative, and hall union elections scheduled for Thursday.
